column5: I am considering taking a major fishing/road trip into Canada this summer, most likely either to Manitoba or Sask. I'd be pulling a 19' Skeeter and we'd either camp or stay at a lodge, whichever makes the most sense. I am looking for recommendations on destinations that I can drive (safely) to that are off the beaten path and offer fishing for lake trout, pike, walleyes, etc. I'm interested in a good adventure up North as well as great fishing. Thanks in advance
Where do you live? Any interest in Ontario?
I'd head to the Flin Flon area. Lots of lakes around there that you can easily access.I have fished Amisk Lake a few times-- great lake for northerns, and good for eyes too.
Gypsy trip.... Pick a lake or area, go fish it. I you do well find a place nearby or camp. If you do not do well, move on to a new lake or area. Repeat.

I used to camp and fish at Mirond Lake, Sask. some time ago. Nice camp ground overlooking the lake, was good fishing. Don't know present camps available, stayed at the second camp on right side. Lake is fairly close to the border, NW of Flin Flon, Manitoba. Bill
